task_summary: Locate the cabinet door handle, grasp it, open the door, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator with a parallel gripper operates in a kitchen scene. The camera shows a countertop with a tissue box, a cabinet with drawers and a right-hand hinged door near a refrigerator. The robot must visually locate the door handle, approach and align precisely, grasp the handle, actuate the opening of the hinged door, then release and back away to a safe standoff. Timeouts, small approach tolerance, and moderate gripping force are used to balance reliability and speed.
preconditions: Robot base positioned with reachable workspace to door handle
No humans or obstacles in immediate arm path
stepwise_plan: Scan and detect the door handle
Move to the handle and align the gripper
Open gripper, then close on the handle
Command container opening for a hinged door
success_criteria: Door opened beyond initial closed position by a visible margin
No collision with cabinet, fridge, or countertop
Gripper releases handle and robot retreats to safe distance
failure_and_recovery: Grip slip → reopen and regrasp with same force
Door jams → retry container open once before abort
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when door is opened and the robot has released the handle and retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper closely aligned with the vertical handle; optimal pre-grasp pose visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Closing on the handle followed by opening action is expected.

node_specs.description: Active scan pattern to find the handle.
Confirm the handle is visible and localized.
Translate end-effector to the handle pose.
Refine pose for a precise grasp.
Prepare gripper aperture for the handle.
Close on the handle with moderate force.
Actuate opening of the hinged cabinet door.
Back off to a safe standoff after release.

recovery_strategy: Repeat scan up to max attempts
Retry open once, then abort safely
assumptions: Frames show a vertical handle on a hinged cabinet door; this conflicts with instruction 'open drawer'. Design follows the frames as required.
Door is right-hinged and opens outward from the robot.

expected_success_criteria: Door angle increases and gripper disengages cleanly
No collisions and stable arm motion
